Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies

Class CPUStrategy

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.CPUStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayStrategy
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefensiveStrategy, GropingStrategy, OffensiveStrategy
public abstract class CPUStrategy extends Object implements PlayStrategy

Concrete CPU strategy. Base for all CPU strategies.

Defines all behaviors that are common between all strategies.

Also defines some methods that are used by most strategies, but can be overriden to add extra behaviors or to modify the default behavior.

This classe's most important feature is to manage the strategy's CardValueMap.

See Also:
  • PlayStrategy
  • OffensiveStrategy
  • DefensiveStrategy
  • GropingStrategy

  • Field Details

    • goodEffectThresold

      protected int goodEffectThresold
      When a card's effect's value is equal or above to this thresold, it is considered valuable.
      See Also:
      • CardValue.getHuntValue()
      • CardValue.getWitchValue()

      protected int goodCardThresold

    • gameIsTightThresold

      protected int gameIsTightThresold
      When the number of unrevealed remaining players is equal or lower than this thresold, the game is considered tight

    • acceptableCardsLimit

      protected int acceptableCardsLimit
      When the player has a playable cards count equal or lower than this thresold, they will consider they lack cards.

    • cvm

      protected CardValueMap cvm

      All CPU strategies make their decisions using a map that associates each existing Rumour card with its value.

      This map has handy methods that can return the list of cards with the best or worst Hunt! effects, for example.

      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

  • Method Details

    • isOkayToReveal

      protected boolean isOkayToReveal(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile rcp)

      In some particular situations, a CPU player can accept to reveal their identity even though they have still other choices.

      Returns true if the strategy judges revealing the player's identity is okay, that is to say : + The player is a villager. + The game is not tight + The player has got playable cards with decent Hunt! effects. + The player considers themselves short on cards.

      Parameters:
      identity - The identity of the player using this strategy.
      rcp - The hand of the player using this strategy.
      Returns:
      true if the strategy judges revealing the player's identity is okay, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • PlayStrategy.revealOrDiscard(Identity, RumourCardsPile)
      • PlayStrategy.selectDefenseAction(Identity, RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • Player::revealIdentity()
      • Player::getIdentity()
      • Player::getHand()

    • wantsCards

      protected boolean wantsCards(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Asserts whether the strategy should consider the player short on cards or not.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The hand of the player using this strategy.
      Returns:
      true if the Rumour cards count in the player's hand is equal or below this strategy's limit, false otherwise.

    • findsValuable

      protected boolean findsValuable(RumourCard rc, Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand)

      Asserts whether a Rumour card should be considered valuable or not, depending on the situation and of the card's values and special benefits.

      For example, when playing as a witch, even if a card's Witch? effect value is not juged interesting, it can be valuable if it is a protective card.

      Parameters:
      rc - The Rumour card the value of which is being discussed.
      myIdentity - The identity of the player using this strategy.
      myHand - The hand of the player using this strategy.
      Returns:
      true if the card is found valuable by this strategy, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • getAverageUnrevealedCardsNumber

      public double getAverageUnrevealedCardsNumber()
      Returns the average number of unrevealed cards, all players considered.

      Used for assessing the clutchness of the situation. If the players are averagely short on cards, offensive actions become more interesting.

      Returns:
      The average count of unrevealed cards, all active players considered.
      See Also:
      • Tabletop::getActivePlayersList

    • updateCardValueMap

      public void updateCardValueMap(boolean iAmRevealed, Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand)

      Responsible of updating the card-value map depending on the situation.

      Avoids using disadvantageous cards : for example, using Toad or Cauldron, which makes yourself reveal your identity, is always suicidal for Witches and should be done by Villagers only in specific situations.

      Finds an instance of a card of a given class using ExistingRumourCards#getInstanceByClass(Class), which returns the unique instance of a card of the given class.

      The card's current value is obtained using CardValueMap.getValueByCard(RumourCard). It is modified using CardValueMap.setValueFor(RumourCard, CardValue). It is protected against modification using CardValue.lock() and unprotected using CardValue.unlock()

      Parameters:
      iAmRevealed - The reveal status of the player using this strategy.
      myIdentity - The identity of the player using this strategy.
      myHand - The hand of the player using this strategy.
      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap
      • ExistingRumourCards
      • ExistingRumourCards.getInstanceByClass(Class)
      • CardValueMap.getValueByCard(RumourCard)
      • CardValueMap.setValueFor(RumourCard, CardValue)
      • CardValue.lock()
      • CardValue.unlock()
      • The example of Toad, a card that is most often suicidal.

    • selectTurnAction

      public TurnAction selectTurnAction(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canHunt)

      Chooses an action to perform on the player's turn, based on the current situation.

      When playing as a witch, a CPU Player will logically be more likely to choose to accuse another player, and even more when the situation becomes critical.

      There is always a chance of choosing to play a play a Hunt! effect, excepted when the player only has risked Hunt! effects.

      Specified by:
      selectTurnAction in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      identity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canHunt - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't hunt.
      Returns:
      Either ACCUSE or HUNT.
      See Also:
      • TurnAction
      • CPUPlayer::chooseTurnAction()

    • revealOrDiscard

      public DefenseAction revealOrDiscard(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile rcp)

      Chooses an action between revealing your identity and discard(RumourCard) discarding a Rumour card from your hand, based on the chosen strategy.

      To make this choice, requires knowledge of the calling player's identity and hand.

      Will almost always choose to discard a card, excepted when the strategy judges that it is okay to reveal and when the strategy finds valuable the card that it would choose to discard.
      Specified by:
      revealOrDiscard in interface PlayStrategy
      Returns:
      Either DefenseAction#REVEAL or DefenseAction#DISCARD
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::revealOrDiscard()
      • DefenseAction
      • DuckingStool

    • selectBestCard

      public RumourCard selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile rcp, boolean seeUnrevealedCards)
      Selects the best card according to the strategy within a given pile of Rumour cards. Useful when picking a new card or taking back a revealed card from your own hand. Default definition for what is the "best" card within a pile.
      Specified by:
      selectBestCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the best card has to be selected.
      seeUnrevealedCards - If this boolean is true, the strategy will be able to access the properties of unrevealed cards as well.
      Returns:
      A random card in a list made of the cards with the best overall value + the unrevealed cards if they can't be seen
      See Also:
      • selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectCardToDiscard

      public RumourCard selectCardToDiscard(RumourCardsPile rcp)

      Specified by:
      selectCardToDiscard in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which a card must be selected to be discarded.
      Returns:
      the worst card found within the given deck.
      See Also:
      • discard
      • selectWorstCard(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectHuntCard

      public RumourCard selectHuntCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Hunt! effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. Default definition of what is the best Hunt! card to play for a strategy.
      Specified by:
      selectHuntCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      The card with the best Hunt! effect value within the given deck.
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxHuntValue(RumourCardsPile)

    • selectDefenseAction

      public DefenseAction selectDefenseAction(Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canWitch)

      Selects an answer to an accusation.

      To make this choice, requires knowledge of the calling player's identity, hand and ability to play a Witch? effect.

      Common definition of what is the best action to perform when accused.
      Specified by:
      selectDefenseAction in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      myIdentity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canWitch - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't play a Witch? effect.
      Returns:
      DefenseAction.REVEAL only if the strategy judges it is okay to reveal, DefenseAction.WITCH otherwise.
      See Also:
      • DefenseAction
      • Player::defend()

    • selectWorstCard

      public RumourCard selectWorstCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Default definition of what is the worst card within the given deck. Useful when choosing a card to discard.
      Returns:
      A random card among the ones with the lowest overall values
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMinOverallValue(RumourCardsPile)

    • updateBehavior

      public void updateBehavior(boolean amIRevealed, Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand)

      Updates the behavior the strategy according to the player's identity, reveal status and hand. Could also call a method that updates a map the keys of which would be players, for the strategy to dynamically select adversaries to target depending on their actions and status.

      Specified by:
      updateBehavior in interface PlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      amIRevealed - The reveal status of the calling player
      myIdentity - The calling player's identity.
      myHand - The calling player's hand.
